uniol.apt.generator.module

Class AbstractGeneratorModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • uniol.apt.module.AbstractModule
      • uniol.apt.generator.module.AbstractGeneratorModule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Module
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BistatePhilNetGeneratorModule, BitNetGeneratorModule, ConnectedBitNetGeneratorModule, QuadstatePhilNetGeneratorModule, TristatePhilNetGeneratorModule

    public abstract class AbstractGeneratorModule
extends AbstractModule
    Abstract module for generating Petri nets.
    Author:
    Uli Schlachter, vsp

      • createGenerator

        protected abstract NetGenerator createGenerator()

      • require

        public void require(ModuleInputSpec inputSpec)
        Description copied from interface: Module
        Specify the parameters of the module. To specify a parameter the ModuleInputSpec.addParameter(String, Class, String, String...) method can be used. The order of specified parameters matters.
        Parameters:
        inputSpec - specification of parameters (input values)

      • provide

        public void provide(ModuleOutputSpec outputSpec)
        Description copied from interface: Module
        Specify the return values of the module. To specify a return value the ModuleOutputSpec.addReturnValue(String, Class, String...) method can be used. The order of specified return values matters.
        Parameters:
        outputSpec - specification of return values (output values)

      • run

        public void run(ModuleInput input,
                ModuleOutput output)
         throws ModuleException
        Description copied from interface: Module
        Perform some computation on the values stored in the ModuleInput object and store the results in the ModuleOutput object. To retrieve values from ModuleInput object the ModuleInput.getParameter(String, Class) method can be used. To store values in the ModuleOutput object the ModuleOutput.setReturnValue(String, Class, Object) method can be used. The possible values in both the ModuleInput and ModuleOutput object are determined entirely by the specifications in the Module.require(ModuleInputSpec) and Module.provide(ModuleOutputSpec) method respectively.
        Parameters:
        input - storage of the inputs
        output - storage of the outputs
        Throws:
        ModuleException - On various kinds of errors that prevent the module from working.
        See Also:
        for an example implementation

      • getCategories

        public Category[] getCategories()
        Description copied from interface: Module
        Returns the categories the module belongs to. The categories are used to improve the module overview making particular modules faster to find. If null is returned the module is automatically assigned to the default category.
        Specified by:
        getCategories in interface Module
        Overrides:
        getCategories in class AbstractModule
        Returns:
        an array of categories
